alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Marinette; Oconto; Outagamie; Shawano; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 6:15PM CDT until June 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Brown County in northeastern Wisconsin... Kewaunee County in northeastern Wisconsin... Southern Marinette County in northeastern Wisconsin... Door County in northeastern Wisconsin... Northwestern Calumet County in east central Wisconsin... Northeastern Winnebago County in east central Wisconsin... Northeastern Waupaca County in northeastern Wisconsin... Southern Oconto County in northeastern Wisconsin... Eastern Outagamie County in northeastern Wisconsin... Eastern Shawano County in northeastern Wisconsin... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 615 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Navarino Wildlife Area to 8 miles north of Black Creek to 9 miles north of Little Chute to near Darboy, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Green Bay, Pulaski and Bellevue Town around 625 PM CDT. Gillett around 630 PM CDT. Bay Shore Park and Denmark around 635 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Oconto, Luxemburg, Kewaunee, Algoma, Marinette, Sturgeon Bay, Menominee and Egg Harbor. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Marinette; Oconto; Outagamie; Shawano; Waupaca; Winnebago
